intro: Tragacantha juvenalis, commonly known as the young tragacanth, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect stems and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by pods containing several seeds. Tragacantha juvenalis is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh environments due to its deep root system and drought tolerance.
